intro: Nothofagus pseudoresinosa, commonly known as the false myrtle or resinous nothofagus, is a species of evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Nothofagus genus, which is part of the beech family (Fagaceae). The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, providing protection against harsh environmental conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain one or two seeds. Nothofagus pseudoresinosa plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, contributing to forest biodiversity and soil stability.
